caption:
On this day 57 years ago, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his final, prophetic speech: 'I've Been to the Mountaintop.' ✊🏾🔥"⁠
⁠
Standing before a crowd in Memphis on April 3, 1968, Dr. King spoke with an urgency that still resonates today. He reflected on the struggles of the Civil Rights Movement, the fight for economic justice, and the promise of a better future. His words on economic power and collective action still resonate today.⁠
⁠
💬 “We've got to strengthen Black institutions. I call upon you to take your money out of the banks downtown and deposit your money in Tri-State Bank—we want a ‘bank-in’ movement in Memphis.”⁠
⁠
Dr. King understood that economic empowerment was key to liberation. He urged Black communities to invest in their own financial institutions, boycott businesses that exploited Black workers, and build collective economic strength. His message is a reminder that where we spend and invest our money is a powerful tool for change.⁠
⁠
Less than 24 hours later, he was assassinated, but his words and mission live on. Dr. King's vision for justice, equality, and economic empowerment remains as powerful and necessary as ever. #BlackExcellence
